topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a85f9563687266c30002db#post_55a85f9563687266c30002db
Alright. Argument over.

Just wanted to say I kinda disagree with this statement. Because it assume that's the fans the movies have built will immediately leave after the movies end.

The fans that came from the movie probably won't just leave. They will probably stay for a bit. Comic sales sertianly won't be anything specular, but I highly doubt there will be a crash. Drop in sales yes. Massive crash? No. Probably just go back to number of sales it had pre movies.

Which...really isn't all that different from now.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a8669763687221ed00013b#post_55a8669763687221ed00013b
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a8660b63687221da000091#post_55a8660b63687221da000091
 It probably would have been better if it had. A bit greyer morality.

If I remember right there was one guy who need pollution to live.

Have captain P tackle THAT.[/bq]
That was why Captain Planet was one sided. It portrays the polluters as shit heads who pollute for the heck of doing it. Only Lootn Plunder seem to have had a valid motive for his activities, as he was a profiteer. In real life, people usually don't pollute for the heck of it. Pollution and environmental destruction are often unintended consequences of human a action, aside from natural pollution.
